intro: Cathartolinum puberulum, commonly known as the hairy cathartolinum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a slightly serrated edge. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
